intro: Erigeron bizgensis, commonly known as the Tibetan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing a compact growth habit adapted to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron bizgensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in local ecosystems.
